newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait share index rises 1pct in easy trade week.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait share index rises 1pct in easy trade week.

text.p: Kuwait's share index edged up one percent in thin trade in the week to Wednesday starting what dealers called a "normal" recovery after dipping in the previous week amid crash fears, dealers said on Thursday.
"The correction witnessed was mainly caused by talk of a crash. The market could regain the April levels in the coming weeks," said an investor.
The index and trade levels hit record high levels in April.
"It is normal that prices recover," said another, echoing the views of fellow dealers.
The index finished the week at 2,320.2 points with gainers leading losers 28-20. Ninteen shares did not change.

Earlier this month some parliamentarians warned of a market crash potential. Officials were swift to issue reassuring statements, but some economists said market fundamentals did not explain big rises in prices and trade levels.
Analysts have said some big investors are forming pools to drive prices up, and warn of negative effects on smaller investors.

In the week to Wednesday the daily average value of traded shares fell to 37 million dinars ($122.8 million) from 70 million. Volume eased to a daily average of 119.4 million shares from 237.4 million, Kuwait Stock Exchange (KSE) figures showed.
Investment firms were the most active in terms of traded value with 59 million dinars, followed by real estate firms with 39.4 million and banks with 39.2 million.
United Realty, Kuwait Real Estate, Investment Projects, The International Investor, Real Estate Bank and Gulf Bank were among the most active shares.
Only nationals of Gulf Arab states -- Saudi Arabia, Bahrain, United Arab Emirates, Qatar, Oman and Kuwait -- can trade on the exchange. Foreign residents can invest in mutual funds.
